intro: Dendroseris berteroana, commonly known as the Andean rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Dendroseris berteroana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
